result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 21CF470 & 22CF39.  Defendant Darren R Olson in court, in custody.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John P Bjork in court for Darren R Olson. Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Darren R. Olson.1:50 p.m. AO-Clerk.  Ct addresses PSI. Defendant states he does not wish to withdraw his plea. Parties have rec'd PSI. Ct notes errors on pgs. 13, 17 &18. Atty Wood Webster addresses court.  DOlson addresses court. 3:29 p.m. recess. 3:42 p.m. back on. Atty Bjork addresses court. 3:51 p.m. recess. 3:54 p.m. back on. 4:20 p.m. recess. 4:36 p.m. back on. 

SENTENCE 

Count 5 - DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $10 fine plus costs totaling $290.60, May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor, Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights, eligible for CIP & SAP, w/h sentence, 1 year conditional time, subj to WR, not subject to GT, 5 years probation, absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no possession of controlled substance w/out a prescription, subj to testing upon reasonable suspicion, no known contact with known users or dealers unless in a treatment or confinement setting, comply with any programming required by DOC. 

Count 7 - DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $10 fine plus costs plus drug surcharge totaling $300.05, May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor, Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights, eligible for CIP & SAP, w/h sentence, 4 years probation, absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no possession of controlled substance w/out a prescription, subj to testing upon reasonable suspicion, no known contact with known users or dealers unless in a treatment or confinement setting, comply with any programming required by DOC. 

241 days credit if revoked. PCR. Periods of supervision concurrent with one another. 5:12 p.m. adj.
Sentencing hearing on May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASES: 21CF470 & 22CF39.  11:05 a.m. Defendant Darren R Olson in court with attorney John P Bjork.  Defendant Darren R Olson in custody.  Holly D. Wood Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk.
21CF470-
Count 5-poss firearm by felon/repeater-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
Count 7-poss meth repeater/PTAC-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
All other counts DRI
22CF39-DRI
Motion for joinder is withdrawn.

Order PSI, long form.  PSI due 4/29.  Bond cont.  11:41 am adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:49 PM. JL-Clerk.  Defendant Darren R Olson in court with attorney A.W. Schutte.  Defendant Darren R Olson in custody. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. State calls Deputy Neumann - S&T. CT finds identification made. State req CT take JN of JOC in 19CF143. CT takes JN. Cross by Atty Schutte. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. Atty Schutte objects to CT's jurisdiction, notes concerns with speedy trial timelines based on date of offense. CT finds date of filing of complaint starts timelines for speedy trial demands, not the date of the offense. CT finds that any remedy would be a signature bond which Def has refused. State again offers to amend to signature bond. Atty Schutte declines. Bond cont. 4:02 pm adj.  Arraignment scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 15, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Not to have contact with Christopher Gates or Thomas R Johnson.  Not to have contact with Nicole Steele except as necessary for the children. No controlled substances without a prescription.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.

01:22 PM Attorney Travis Satorius appeared by video means.  Holly D. Wood Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darren R Olson appeared by video means from PCJ, in custody.  CW-clerk.  Atty Bjork has underlying file, 21CF470.  Def asking that no bond be set.  ADA-no obj to signature bond.  JA to set for PH w/in 20 days w/ counsel.  Bond cont.  1:34 pm adj.
